alert.note: Alert for Butler (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 8:03PM CDT until March 26 at 11:24AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Black River at Poplar Bluff affecting Butler County. .Heavy rain over the last day will result in significant rises on the Black River. The river is forecast to crest at Poplar Bluff around 2 feet above flood stage tomorrow afternoon. For the Black River...including Poplar Bluff...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River at Poplar Bluff. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, U.S. Highway 60 begins to flood heading toward Baskey. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Friday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 18.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
